definition: petty official charged with reporting back to the ruler on what people in a locality are talking about (old)/novel in the vernacular/fiction writer/novelist

sentences.english: Many interesting stories originated from unofficial histories.
sentences.chinese: 许多有趣的故事源自于稗官野史。

definition: anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
official in charge of public records
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
Extensive records of the Taiping era (978), fictional history edited by Li Fang 李昉
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
to copy/to pass on a copy
Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
Chu Renhuo (17th century), author of historical novel Dramatized History of Sui and Tang 隋唐演義|隋唐演义
Zhengzitong, Chinese character dictionary with 33,549 entries, edited by Ming scholar Zhang Zilie 張自烈|张自烈[Zhang1 Zi4 lie4] in 17th century
